page.title: 12TRANSPORT IN WELSHPOOL
page.content: Welshpool lies at the junction of the main north-south Wales route, the {A 490,}and the main route between the Midlands and the coastal resorts of the Lleyn Peninsula, the{A 458.}This latter route leads to much congestion in the summer and many people feel that a by-pass is urgently required. {Bus services}are run mainly by Crosville linking the town with Newtown, Oswestry, Shrewsbury, Llanidloes and Llanfair Caereinion. A local service runs between the major housing estates and the town centre. The "Traws Cymru" (Across Wales) route between Liverpool and Cardiff runs twice weekly through the town. {Welshpool railway station}lies on the Cambrian Line between Shrewsbury and Aberystwyth. About 17 trains run daily through the town. These are passenger trains with only a few freight trains.
